identified-content.classifier: Top/News/Sports/Pro Basketball/National Basketball Association/New York Knicks

block.p: The Knicks, still searching for depth in the frontcourt, have an interest in Dickey Simpkins, a free agent who has played most of his six-year career with the Chicago Bulls. Simpkins, a 6-foot-9-inch power forward/center, is best known for serving as a part-time bruiser and screen setter for Michael Jordan during the Bulls' run to the 1996, 1997 and 1998 championships.

The Knicks could sign Simpkins with their $2.25 million midlevel exception or offer him a minimum contract worth $736,000. It may take the larger sum to acquire Simpkins, since the Los Angeles Lakers also have an interest in him and are believed to be his first choice.

The Knicks, still searching for depth in the frontcourt, have an interest in Dickey Simpkins, a free agent who has played most of his six-year career with the Chicago Bulls. Simpkins, a 6-foot-9-inch power forward/center, is best known for serving as a part-time bruiser and screen setter for Michael Jordan during the Bulls' run to the 1996, 1997 and 1998 championships.

The Knicks could sign Simpkins with their $2.25 million midlevel exception or offer him a minimum contract worth $736,000. It may take the larger sum to acquire Simpkins, since the Los Angeles Lakers also have an interest in him and are believed to be his first choice.

Simpkins, who averaged 4.2 points and 5.4 rebounds in 23.9 minutes for the Bulls last season, has career averages of 4.2 points and 3.6 rebounds. His best season came in 1998-99, when he averaged 9.1 points, 6.8 rebounds and 29 minutes for Chicago.
